title: Coleford Milkwall and Parkend Railway Path Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Stuart Wilding / Cycle Track, Forest of Dean., via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cycle Track, Forest of Dean. The forest used to have a lot of railway lines to take the coal away. Many of these have now been converted to cycle paths. This was the old Parkend to Coleford line.

images.title: Gillett's Crossing from Bristol, United Kingdom [CC BY 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Great Western Railway Museum, Coleford

images.title: Path on the route of a former railway, Milkwall by Jaggery, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Path on the route of a former railway, Milkwall

images.title: Former cottages near Parkend by Gareth James, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Former cottages near Parkend

images.title: Milkwall side of the cycle track to Coleford by Jaggery, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Milkwall side of the cycle track to Coleford

images.title: Forester2009, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Point Quarry on the cycle trail from Parkend to Milkwall

description: This short cycling and walking path follows the disused Coleford Milkwall and Parkend railway from Coleford to Parkend. You will head into the peaceful Forest of Dean passing Milkwall station and the disused Darkhill Ironworks on the way. The route links with National Cycle route 42 with more details on the Forest of Dean Family Route. Also nearby is the fascinating Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail where you'll find a lovely walking trail taking you to a collection of high-quality, contemporary sculptures in a beautiful woodland setting.
